name: Thief Town
description: Thief Town is a local multiplayer stealth action game set in a pixel-perfect rendition of the Wild West. Lurk in the crowd, emulate non-player characters, and achieve backstabbing victory.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo Memory: 3 GB RAM Graphics: Intel Core HD Graphics (2000/3000), or dedicated GPU with OpenGL Support Storage: 200 MB available space Sound Card: OpenAL-Compatible
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel Core i3 Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Intel Core HD Graphics 4000, or dedicated GPU with OpenGL Support Storage: 200 MB available space Sound Card: OpenAL-Compatible

reviews.review_text: A simple yet persistently fun game of imitating NPCs and stabbing. Stab friends. Stab family. Stab everyone. In this game I mean.
I love this game, this is the most amount of thieves I have ever stabbed in a video game. I really like the music so I was glad to find out that the soundtrack was included in the bundle.

This is probably one of my favorite games to play wiyh friends. The pixel graphics go great wu=ith the style of the game. The gameplay is stellar and you always end up having a great time. The only thing they need is online multiplayr instead of LAN, otherwise this game is definitely one of the better games out there. 9/10

WARNING!!! BEFORE YOU BUY THIS GAME MAKE SURE YOU HAVE SOMEONE TO PLAY THIS WITH, IT IS LOCAL Wow, where to start with this amazing local multiplayer game. Thief Town is a game where you, and however many other people, are placed in a game, with many other AIs. Your goal is to try and find out who the other people are by memorizing the way the people walk, etc. And when you find out who said player is, you 'stab' the player who you think is real, causing them to bleed. It's almost like Last Person Standing, but in a crowd of people. It is very hard how to determine who people are, especially in 4 player. 2 Player mode is just as fun.   DOWNSIDE!!! No online multiplayer.  9/10
Really fun but needs online multiplayer.

Thief Town  is a small local couch multiplayer game where the main goal is to find your friends in a crowd of AI, all the while staying hidden yourself.  Very similiar to  Hidden in Plain Sight .  Its cheap. Its short. Its *mildly* entertaining in short bursts. I played with a group of three people and we quickly wanted to go back to our usual games.    No, I don't recommend getting this, simply because there is so little gameplay, and overall reaction was very meh for my group of friends.   Things that could be improved on? I don't know honestly. I'd say it overall lacks any kind of complexity that keeps a group interested. There is very little skill involved.
Fun game to play with friends while drinking. Too bad it's only local and LAN play. Should have internet multiplayer.
Raised price by $4. I don't recommend. Replay value is kind of bad.

We were drunk and could not figure out how to play this - that's a big flaw for a 'party' game. For some idiotic reason every player have to setup his own control layout after joining. Gameplay is too random, there is no point in concealing yourself amongst other thiefs since the screen is too small and you can simply stab three guys at once and kill your foes by accident.

Garbage game. They find a way to make it cross-platform yet can't make it simple to actually play on a local network.  Do NOT get unless you plan to play on literally the same machine or connect through ethernet or some s***.   Too bad too. Just a little effort into the execution and it probably would have been fun.

This game is only good if you are playing with all your mates who are typing on the same keyboard or on a different computer. This game does not have online multiplayer. I wasted $4.00 for pixelated crap.

Game says it has multiplayer, but it's only local? Please either update that or add normal multiplayer so I can actually put my 4 pack to good use please. DO NOT BUY IF YOU ARE EXPECTING ONLINE MULTIPLAYER!
